title: Geography Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of world geography, countries, capitals, and landmarks.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia, not Sydney or Melbourne as many people incorrectly assume.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is generally considered the longest river in the world, flowing for approximately 6,650 kilometers (4,130 miles).

questions.question: Which country has the largest land area?
questions.explanation: Russia is the largest country by land area, covering approximately 17.1 million square kilometers (6.6 million square miles).

questions.question: Which mountain range separates Europe and Asia?
questions.explanation: The Ural Mountains form a natural boundary between Europe and Asia.

questions.question: Which of these countries is NOT in Africa?
questions.explanation: Suriname is located in South America, while Chad, Namibia, and Mozambique are all African countries.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world by land area?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world, with a total area of approximately 0.49 square kilometers (0.19 square miles).

questions.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
questions.explanation: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, covering an area of approximately 9.2 million square kilometers (3.6 million square miles).

questions.question: Which of these cities is NOT located on the Mediterranean Sea?
questions.explanation: Lisbon is located on the Atlantic Ocean, while Barcelona, Marseille, and Alexandria are all located on the Mediterranean Sea.

questions.question: Which country has the most natural lakes?
questions.explanation: Canada has more lakes than any other country in the world, with an estimated 2 million lakes.

questions.question: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of which country?
questions.explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system and is located off the coast of Queensland, Australia.
